[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Concurrency: Shared State] If HumanReadable<StateKey> instances are shared across threads during simulation, can race conditions in Display or from_str cause data corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Concurrency: Cache Poisoning] If parsed StateKeys are cached for performance, can an attacker poison the cache with malicious keys that are then used by other simulation sessions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Unicode: Module Names] Can unicode normalization differences in IdentStr::new() cause the same logical module name to parse into different StateKeys, breaking determinism? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Unicode: String Splitting] Can unicode characters that visually resemble '::' but are different code points bypass the split() logic and inject malicious path components? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Unicode: Right-to-Left Override] Can RTL unicode characters (U+202E) reverse the visual display of StateKeys while keeping the parsed structure malicious? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Integer: Address Parsing] Can AccountAddress::from_str() handle addresses with more than 32 bytes or negative values, potentially causing integer overflow or memory corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Integer: Hex Length] Can hex::decode() handle extremely large hex strings (e.g., 2^63 characters) without integer overflow when calculating buffer sizes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Type Safety: StructTag Validation] Can StructTag::from_str() accept invalid Move type signatures that should be rejected by the Move VM's type system? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Type Safety: Generic Parameters] Can unbounded generic type parameters in StructTags cause type confusion or bypass Move's ability system checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Validation: Address Range] Does AccountAddress::from_str() validate that addresses are within valid ranges for the Aptos network (e.g., not reserved addresses)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Resource Safety: Double Access] Can crafting two different human-readable StateKeys that deserialize to the same binary StateKey allow double-spending attacks in resource-oriented Move code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Resource Safety: Type Confusion] Can resource StateKeys be confused with resource_group StateKeys to bypass Move's resource isolation and access data across resource boundaries? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Gas: Parsing Cost] Is the gas cost of parsing human-readable StateKeys properly metered during simulation, or can attackers submit expensive-to-parse keys without paying appropriate gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Performance: Repeated Parsing] If StateKeys are parsed multiple times during a simulation session, can this be exploited for performance degradation without triggering gas limits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Crypto: Hash Consistency] If StateKeys are used in cryptographic operations (e.g., Merkle tree hashing), can different human-readable representations of the same key cause hash inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Crypto: Determinism] Is the conversion from human-readable to binary StateKey format deterministic across all validator nodes and Rust compiler versions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Compatibility: Version Changes] If the StateKey format changes in future Aptos versions, can old human-readable formats still be parsed, or will this break existing tools and integrations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Compatibility: Legacy Keys] Can legacy StateKey formats from previous Aptos versions be exploited to bypass newer security restrictions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Error Recovery: Partial Parsing] If parsing fails midway through a StateKey string, are intermediate allocations properly cleaned up, or can this cause memory leaks in long-running validators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Resilience: Malformed Input] Can the parser gracefully handle arbitrarily malformed inputs without panicking or entering undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Access Control: System Addresses] Can an attacker craft StateKeys that access system addresses (0x0, 0x1) to read or simulate operations on protected framework code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Authorization: Signer Bypass] Can StateKeys be crafted to access resources at addresses without proper signer authorization during simulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [State Corruption: Key Collision] Can hash collisions between different human-readable StateKeys cause writes to overwrite unrelated state entries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [State Corruption: Encoding Mismatch] Can differences between human-readable and binary StateKey encodings cause state reads to return wrong data during simulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Simulation: State Leakage] Can simulation sessions using human-readable StateKeys leak information about private state that should not be accessible to transaction originators? (High)
